text: when I was first coming out I was so

and not myself that the bullying

wouldn't have anyone to take to the prom
I was afraid of getting kicked out and
not having anywhere to go for the

afraid I wasn't gay why be out if I
didn't have to be out I was convinced
that being gay would keep me from
achieving my career goals I was
concerned I wasn't going to be accepted
by my community that I'd lose all my

about being gay was losing all my
friends losing all my family uh being
gay has a certain stigma from where I'm
from I'm from a Catholic country and The
Stereotype of gay is uh parlor gay you
know skinny with ribbons in her hair
almost being the village idiot I felt
that if I were to come out I would lose

just see me as this loud bright dancing

we always the holidays are so special to

lining everything up preparing for the
worst preparing that when I came out I

to an all boy school so it was very uh

a sense of
paranoia a sense of second guessing

do I seem gay or oh did I am I am I
dating enough girls or you you know you

everything you do you think like am I
does this make me gay does this make me
gay or do people think I'm gay is
this you just hyper you're hypercritical
of absolutely everything about your life
such that you're constantly working to
not be yourself and it takes a lot of
energy to constantly not be yourself I
remember when I would be driving home

this turn and there wasn't a guard rail
and it was kind of almost every day have

think it was just reaching a breaking

I get one life and it's passing me by
and I've really got no one to blame but
myself cuz I'm the one making the choice
I felt nauseous when I first thought

small started with one person and that

relieved once I opened up to one it and
I asked for validation from him do you
think I asked him do you think that
other people would find it embarrassing
to to be considered a friend of mine and

encouraged me to reach out to a third

fifth and pretty much everyone who's who
matters in my life know no there was a
relief um that I didn't have to put on
this show I think that I generally was a
nicer sort of less paranoid more
outgoing more friendly person got a lot
better uh life is so much more I mean I
I have a life now and I like it a lot
it's helped me socially in terms of
being at ease with others it's helped me
professionally after I came out it was
like my life began at that moment I'm
mad that I didn't let myself have this
sooner um because it got so much better
so quickly the biggest gift I ever gave

who I am and to really love myself to
anyone who's thinking of harming
themselves who's finding themselves in
the same position of
vulnerability try to find that one

that that friend of yours who who you
think will not judge you who you think
will be there for you no matter what and
open up to him or her your life might
not feel great now but it's going to
